Sentence.sentence: Participation grows through friends and networks and if you realize that's how they're growing, you can start to take action and bring in other students, he said.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For instance, new technologies that are building upon existing technology have not found their footing well  enough to appeal to a mass audience, because, in many cases, they need to work effectively with other devices to realize their full appeal.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: What Nijay didn't realize about his school—Tennessee State University — was its frighteningly low graduation rate: a mere 29 percent for its first-generation students.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The reality of it is that a lot of low-income kids could be going to elite universities on a full ride scholarship and don't even realize it.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps a new phrase is needed, one that can bring everyone one big step closer to realizing Du Bois's original, idealistic hope: It's not the name—it's the Thing that counts..
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It helps students realize not every question has an answer.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: True, not all U.S.students can match theperformance of their foreign counterparts, but the American institutions do offer students from rich and poor families alike the chance to realize their full potential.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Team management calls for new skills if personnel potential is tobe fully realized.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: If a team manager exemplifies such qualities, then the team as a whole would be better able to realize their potential and achieve their objectives.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Talking to admissions professionals like Boshoven, you realize that the list of "don'ts" in essay writing is much longer than the "dos.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They don't realize how typical their experiences arc
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: it takes patience for humans to realize their dreams
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It cannot be realized without technological innovation.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Corporations in Germany realized that there was an interest to be served economically and patriotically in building up a skilled labor force at home; we never had that ethos (风气)," says Richard Sennett, a New York University sociologist who has written about the connection of craft and culture.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Whether they experiment with three-year degrees, offer year-round classes, challenge the tenure system—or all of the above—universities are slowly realizing that to stay competitive and relevant they must adapt to a rapidly changing world.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Too bad most people don't realize it.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They realized science and technology alone were no guarantee for a better world.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Realizing that this particular audience would find his regional accent unattractive, Larry planned to speak with an accent that would be more acceptable to his audience.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: When James realized how severe her illness was, she knew she had better hurry up and live life.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Today many people have come to realize that help the environment and for the human race to survive, more of us will need to become vegetarian.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: He captures birds only to let them go when he realizes the cruelty involved.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Delia realized the plan was expensive and potentially controversial.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: There is this 'detachment' and I realize that there are obviously experiences which would overwhelm everyone.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Juan realized then that he must present his speech at an elementary level and with a minimum of scientific language.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Because it's such a pity if you start off on a bright tone on a story and suddenly realize you are talking about some people having been killed in a road crash.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: For instance, new technologies that are building upon existing technology have not found their footing well enough to appeal to a mass audience, because, in many cases, they need to work effectively with other devices to realize their full appeal.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: If a fellow says "I'm 94 years old and I worked all my life", we need to realize, that is how he got to be 94, by staying involved.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Participation grows through friends and networks and if "you realize that's how they're growing, you can start to take action" and bring in other students, he said.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps a lot of them don't realize how well we're doing, because we don't make a point of publicizing.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Protein is found in more foods than people might realize.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Whereas now, as I near the end of my fourth decade, I realize work can be fully functional and entirely fulfilling without needing to be best mates with the people sitting next to you.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"产生，实现"之意。
means: effect ： 侧重成功地完成一件要做的事情，强调结果或影响。
cause ： 强调事物的因果关系。
produce ： 侧重有意或无意地产生出好的或坏的，实际可见的效果。
realize ： 着重指把过去的计划或意愿变成现实。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"在思想中形成一个看法或观念"之意。
means: think ： 最普通用词，指想或思索，也指由反复思考而作出判断或得出结论等。
conceive ： 指在头脑中组织好自己的思想，在心中形成一个系统的思想或一个见解。
imagine比conceive更强调形象思维，指在头脑中形成一个清晰明确的意象。
fancy与imagine略不同，往往指的是不切实际的，属于梦幻般的想象。
realize ： 指领悟，通过生动的构思或想象从而抓住事物的本质。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 真的, 真实的, 不动产的
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实→adj.真的, 真实的, 不动产的
realist[n.现实主义者]+ic……的→adj.现实[主义]的
un不+real真实,现实→adj.不真实的, 虚幻的
real真实,现实+ly表副词→adv.真正地, 实在地
real真实,现实+ism主义→realism现实主义
real真实,现实+ist人→n.现实主义者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 真实, 事实, 本体, 逼真
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实+ity表名词→n.真实, 事实, 本体, 逼真

stems_affixes.value_cn: 认识到, 了解, 实现, 实行
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实+ize表动词→v.认识到, 了解, 实现, 实行

Sentence.sentence: I do realize the value of the scholarship.

Sentence.sentence: I soon realized that the silence was not unpleasant.

Sentence.sentence: In 1819, John realized that he didn't have enough money to pay his bills.

Sentence.sentence: In her excitement, she didn't seem to realize that she was sharing the baby's photos with a complete stranger.

Sentence.sentence: It didn't take long for Shelly-Ann to realize that sports could be her way out of Waterhouse.

Sentence.sentence: It seemed an unending journey, but even as a six-year-old girl I realized that knowing how to read could open many doors.

Sentence.sentence: It was when we were returning home that I realized what a good feeling it was to have helped someone in trouble.

Sentence.sentence: Many westerners who/that come to China cook much less than in their own countries once they realize how cheap it can be to eat out.

Sentence.sentence: These were the real deal- and at that moment, I realized that the best part of sarasota in winter was going to be eating things that back home in New York I wouldn't be experiencing again for months.

Sentence.sentence: They are potential powers we possess: energy, skill, sound judgment, creative ideas — even physical strength greater than most of US realize.

Sentence.sentence: They help people realize their dreams.

Sentence.sentence: They were almost knee-deep when they realized it was a hot spring.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: We now realize how important family is and how important to be near them, especially when you're raining children.

Sentence.sentence: When I started running in my 30s, I realized running was a battle against myself, not about competition or whether or not I was athletic.

Sentence.sentence: With a sinking feeling, he realized that he actually enjoyed doing it.

Sentence.sentence: You begin to realize that your boy, in your footsteps, could probably accomplish what you hoped for.

Sentence.sentence: If humanity has made some headway in realizing that the ultimate value of every institution is its distinctively human effect we may well believe that this lesson has been learned largely through dealings with the young.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: To realize how great was the dramatic activity, we must remember further that hosts of plays have been lost, and that probably there is no author of note whose entire work has survived.

Sentence.sentence: But phones  run on batteries, and batteries can die faster than we realize.

sentences.en: He realized his dream when he passed the entrance examination.
sentences.cn: 入学考试通过了, 他的梦想就实现了。

means.word_mean: 了解; 认识到; 理解; 领会; 意识到

sentences.en: If you were in the Sahara, you would realize the value of fresh water.
sentences.cn: 如果你在撒哈拉大沙漠, 你就会知道淡水的价值了。

sentences.en: Columbus had not realized that this new land was not India.
sentences.cn: 哥伦布当时还没有认识到这块新大陆不是印度。

sentences.en: They realized the situation to be against them.
sentences.cn: 他们意识到形势对他们不利。

means.word_mean: 把（概念等）具体表现出来
变卖; 赚得; 把（财产等）变卖; 变现

sentences.en: How much did you realize on the house?
sentences.cn: 这所房子你们出售后赚了多少钱?</seg>

entry.def: If you realize that something is true, you become aware of that fact or understand it.

example.ex: As soon as we realised something was wrong, we moved the children away...
example.tran: 我们刚意识到有什么不对劲就把孩子转移了。

example.ex: People don't realize how serious this recession has actually been...
example.tran: 人们没有意识到这次经济衰退事实上有多严重。

entry.def: If your hopes, desires, or fears are realized, the things that you hope for, desire, or fear actually happen.
entry.tran: （希望、心愿或恐惧）实现，成为现实，发生

example.ex: Straightaway our worst fears were realised...
example.tran: 我们最恐惧的事情一下发生了。

example.ex: Those are our hopes; we are starting this clinical trial to investigate whether those hopes will be realised.
example.tran: 那些就是我们的希望；我们正在开展这些临床试验以调查那些希望是否可以实现。

entry.def: When someone realizes a design or an idea, they make or organize something based on that design or idea.

example.ex: Various textile techniques will be explored to realise design possibilities...
example.tran: 将尝试和探索纺织技巧来把这些设计变为现实。

example.ex: The kaleidoscopic quality of the book is brilliantly realised on stage.
example.tran: 该书包罗万象、精彩纷呈的特质在舞台上得到了精彩再现。

entry.def: If someone or something realizes their potential, they do everything they are capable of doing, because they have been given the opportunity to do so.

example.ex: The support systems to enable women to realize their potential at work are seriously inadequate...
example.tran: 使妇女在工作中发挥潜力的支持体系严重不足。

example.ex: I think probably that the laser has not realised the potential that was expected of it in that domain.
example.tran: 我想可能激光在那个领域并没有充分发挥其潜力。

entry.def: If something realizes a particular amount of money when it is sold, that amount of money is paid for it.

example.ex: A selection of correspondence from P G Wodehouse realised £ 1,232.
example.tran: P.G.沃德豪斯的书信选集卖了1,232英镑。

means.word_mean: 1. be fully aware or cognizant of

sentences.sentence: "Does she realize how important this decision is?"

means.word_mean: 3. make real or concrete; give reality or substance to;

sentences.sentence: "our ideas must be substantiated into actions"

means.word_mean: 4. earn on some commercial or business transaction; earn as salary or wages;

sentences.sentence: "How much do you make a month in your new job?"
"She earns a lot in her new job"
"this merger brought in lots of money"

means.word_mean: 5. convert into cash; of goods and property
6. expand or complete (a thorough-based part in a piece of baroque music) by supplying the harmonies indicated in the figured bass

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from real, on the pattern of French réaliser

sentences.cn: 我没有察觉到你那么不开心。
sentences.en: I didn't realize (that) you were so unhappy.

sentences.cn: 我一看到她，就觉得不太对劲。
sentences.en: The moment I saw her, I realized something was wrong.

sentences.cn: 我认为你没有意识到这对她是多么重要。
sentences.en: I don't think you realize how important this is to her.

sentences.cn: 形势比他们最初意识到的更为复杂。
sentences.en: The situation was more complicated than they had at first realized.

sentences.cn: 我们谁也没注意，他们悄悄走了。
sentences.en: They managed to leave without any of us realizing.

sentences.cn: 我希望你能认识到这一罪行的严重性。
sentences.en: I hope you realize the seriousness of this crime.

sentences.cn: 只是到了后来她才意识到自己的错误。
sentences.en: Only later did she realize her mistake.

sentences.cn: 人们意识到大家都已平安归来的时候便发出了一阵欢呼声。
sentences.en: There was a cheer when it was realized that everyone was safely back.

sentences.en: She never realized her ambition of becoming a professional singer.

sentences.cn: 我们努力帮助所有的学生充分发挥他们的潜力。
sentences.en: We try to help all students realize their full potential (= be as successful as they are able to be) .

sentences.cn: 他一看门被撬了，就知道最担心的事还是发生了。
sentences.en: His worst fears were realized when he saw that the door had been forced open.

sentences.en: I think probably that the laser has not realised the potential that was expected of it in that domain.

sentences.en: She told her boy not to stamp on the floor and disturb the sleeping baby.

sentences.en: You realize that by rights you should not come into this room, don't you? This is only for people who work here.

sentences.cn: 或许需要一个新的词语，一个可以带领大家实现 Du Bois 的原创理想主义愿景：“名字并不重要，重要的是这件事。”
sentences.en: Perhaps a new phrase is needed, one that can bring everyone one big step closer to realizing Du Bois ’ s original, idealistic hope:  “ It ’ s not the name  — it ’ s the Thing that counts. ”
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 如果 一个团队的管理者表现出了这样的品质，那么团队作为一个整体就更能意识 到自己的潜力，从而实现自己的目标。
sentences.en: If a team manager exemplifies such qualities, then the team as a whole would be better able to realize their potential and achieve their objectives.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 诚然，不是所有的美国学生都能比得上外国学生。但是美国学校确实会为富裕和贫穷的家庭提供实现他们潜能的同等机会。
sentences.en: True, not all U.S. students can match the performance of their foreign counterparts, but the American institutions do offer students from rich and poor families alike the chance to realize their full potential.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 仿真结果表明: 设计完全实现了电子计算器的全部功能.

sentences.en: It can easily realize the drive of step motor reliably.

sentences.en: Microbial pesticide is the necessary option for realizing the sustained development.

sentences.en: I hope to realize this dream at university.

sentences.cn: 他实现了他的志向.
sentences.en: He realized his ambition.

sentences.en: The function of the original CPU + CPLD combination can be realized by one FPGA chip.

sentences.en: A data acquisition equipment for the UAV flight test is designed and realized.

sentences.en: Through the program debugging, revision, we have finally realized to control the continuous furnace parts transportation.

sentences.cn: 增强企业实力, 实现收益最大化等.
sentences.en: The enhancement enterprise strength, realizes the income maximization and so on.

sentences.cn: 成功的男人有自己的目标,并为实现它而奋斗.
sentences.en: A successful man always has a goal and strives to realize the goal.

sentences.cn: 结果:分 析系统能实现人体运动图像的在线检测与分析.
sentences.en: Result: The system realizes the human motion image measurement and analysis online.

sentences.cn: 为了解决以上问题, 我们用匈牙利算法(Hungary)实现了多智能体系统的任务分配.
sentences.en: To solve the problem above, we use the Hungary algorithm to realize the task allocation problem.

sentences.en: The papers were stored away in a secret place, and there they will probably remain until they are come across by someone who realized their importance.

sentences.en: Objective To realize characteristics of murder case by forensic psychiatry expertise.

sentences.cn: 她简直是在撒弥天大谎.对她说假话之无耻程度,我们都是了解的.
sentences.en: She just lied in her throat and we all realized toe grossness of her false utterance.

sentences.cn: 当我们了解到自己在招人厌烦时,我们就像泄气的气球. 我当时的情况就是这样.
sentences.en: To realize that one is boring somebody is to become a pricked balloon. I certainly did.

sentences.cn: 你了解她遇到麻烦了 吗 ?
sentences.en: Do you realize ( that ) she was in trouble?

sentences.cn: 我不知道各位爵爷是否了解这其中所涉的损失.
sentences.en: I wonder whether your Lordships realize the loss involved in that.

sentences.cn: 我们不久就了解到她适合当教师.
sentences.en: We soon realized that she was cut out to be a teacher.

sentences.en: As they worked, early manufacturing pioneers realized the need for better methods and developed new ideas.

sentences.cn: 我不十分清楚,公众是否了解这种技术目前可应用于多少种用途.
sentences.en: I don't really know if the public realizes how many uses it's being applied to.

sentences.en: Many members of our audience may not realize that.

sentences.cn: 罗达, 你和帕格之间有许多东西把你们拴在一起, 我充分了解这一点.
sentences.en: Rhoda, you and Pug have many things that bind you together. I fully realize it.

sentences.cn: 唯有在失去健康之后, 我们才能了解健康的重要.
sentences.en: Only after you lose your health, will you realize the importance of health.

sentences.cn: 例︰所以?我们应该了解学英文不能没有字典.
sentences.en: Therefore, we should realize that in learning English we cannot do without dictionary.

sentences.cn: 我们现在对人脑的知识多到足以了解其神秘将永存.
sentences.en: We now know enough about the brain to realize that its mystery will always remain.

sentences.cn: 并且要足够的了解自己,了解自己擅长什麽, 还要相信自己. 如果做到这样你一定能有所作为!
sentences.en: Besides that, you'd better know youself clearly and realize what you're at, also believe in yourself.

sentences.en: Vicky soon realized, however, that their travel philosophies were quite different.

sentences.cn: 然后我了解到,她周身既没有手臂也没有大腿, 有的只是躯干和脖子上面的头部而已.
sentences.en: I then realized she had no arms or legs, just a head, neck and torso.

sentences.en: James and Della realized they cherished each other the most.
